flawed_nl_solution:
If the 12 students had shared the 108 oranges, each student would have gotten 108/12 = <<108/12=9.0>>9.0 oranges
But 36 were removed so there are 108-36 = <<108-36=72>>72 oranges left
So 12 shared 72 for each to get 72/12 = <<72/12=6.0>>6.0 oranges
This is 9.0-6.0 = <<9.0-6.0=7.0>>7.0 less than they would each get if they did not have to throw any orange away.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 3.0, not 7.0. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
